docs.snippet: A D.C. Council member apologized for a social media post in which he claimed that Jewish financiers control the climate.

headline.print_headline: Lawmaker Who Said Rothschilds Control the Climate Apologizes
headline.main: Lawmaker Who Said Rothschilds Control the Climate Apologizes

docs.snippet: Breads Bakery is offering a sturdy variety of matzo balls for the holiday, either in soup or plain.
The Dutch spirits company Bols is bringing back a centuries-old recipe for genever as it works to revive the ancestor of gin.

headline.print_headline: To Sip: Before There Was Gin,  There Was Genever
headline.main: Before There Was Gin, There Was Genever

docs.snippet: A chocolate-covered and cocoa-dusted confection helps tell the tale of a man trying to revive the coffee trade in Yemen.

headline.print_headline: To Nibble: Chocolate Coffee Beans That Help to Tell a Tale
headline.main: Chocolate Coffee Beans With a Story

docs.snippet: Manchester United are trailing Manchester City this season on the pitch but are peerless when it comes to their social media muscle, according to a report published this week.

headline.print_headline: Manchester United Still Flex Most Social Media Muscle
headline.main: Manchester United Still Flex Most Social Media Muscle

docs.snippet: Massachusetts' top securities regulator has ordered five firms that were allegedly conducting initial coin offerings for cryptocurrencies in the state to halt the sale or offer of their "unregistered securities," he said on Tuesday.

headline.print_headline: Massachusetts Regulator Blocks ICOs by Five Firms
headline.main: Massachusetts Regulator Blocks ICOs by Five Firms

docs.snippet: Austria's foreign minister has ordered an attache at the country's embassy in Israel to return home after a newspaper reported that he posted a picture of himself in a T-shirt sold by a far-right group.

headline.print_headline: Austria Envoy Brought Home From Israel Over Far-Right Report
headline.main: Austria Envoy Brought Home From Israel Over Far-Right Report

docs.snippet: A whistleblower at the heart of a Facebook data scandal on Monday questioned the result of Britain's 2016 Brexit referendum as his lawyers presented evidence that they said showed the main campaign for leaving the EU had broken the law.

headline.print_headline: Whistleblower Questions Brexit Result, Says Campaigners Broke Election Law
headline.main: Whistleblower Questions Brexit Result, Says Campaigners Broke Election Law

docs.snippet: U.S. stocks dropped on Monday, with the S&P and Nasdaq suffering their worst day in just over five weeks, as concerns over increased regulation for large tech companies was spearheaded by a plunge in Facebook shares.

headline.print_headline: Wall Street Drops as Regulation Worry Sinks Tech Shares
headline.main: Wall Street Drops as Regulation Worry Sinks Tech Shares
